column1: As blood counts become lower and symptoms develop, blood and platelets are given through transfusions.
Bone marrow or stem cell transplant may be recommended for people under age 40.
Older people and those who do not have a matched sibling donor are given medicine to suppress the immune system.
Untreated, severe aplastic anemia leads to rapid death.
Bone marrow transplant can be very successful in young people.
Transplant is also used in older people or when the disease comes back after medicines have stopped working.

Complications may include: - Severe infections or bleeding - Complications of bone marrow transplant - Reactions to medicines - Hemochromatosis (buildup of too much iron in the body tissues from many red cell transfusions)
